Text: Thank you for coming all this way to visit me today.

No worries. Thanks for making time for me.
I'm sure you're busy.
Not at all. What may I help you with?

I wanted to let you know that I'll be staying in
Midgar for a little longer.

You mentioned the Bushin Festival. Are you looking
for someone there?

When she nods, a look of sympathy flashes across
Princess Iris' face.

Beatrix is worried because not even the higher-ranked
nobles or celebrities seemed to have any useful
information to help locate her niece.

(Not that Princess Iris should be worrying about such
a thing...I don't expect to find her anytime soon.)

As I've said before...there's lots of time,
as I'm an elf. There is no rush.

Understood. But please don't hesitate to let me know
if you need anything.

Thank you. That means a lot. If there's anything
I can do for you as Goddess of War during my
time here, I'd be delighted to help.
...Not that there is anything in particular I can do.
Of course there is! We'd appreciate your help.

Members of the Knight Order who attended the Bushin
Festival the other day are dying to spar with
you, Lady Beatrix.
Including myself as well.

Are you certain? As the Goddess of War, I must've
looked like a fool.

Beatrix means it. That day in battle at the Bushin
Festival...she suffered defeat.

It's not like I don't feel any regret. Shadow spared
me, but I can't shake the painful memory of defeat...

Nevertheless...as someone who was bestowed with
the title "Goddess of War," I can't carry on like this...

I understand. As a princess of this kingdom, I must
become stronger!
Hehe, you're quite strong as you are now, though.

All right. I'll make some time to spar with you
and your soldiers.

I won't be in the mood to teach, though.
Be ready for a full-on battle.

That's what I was hoping for...! I will not hold
back either.
I'm looking forward to it. Well then, I'll be off...

Wait. There's something else I'd like to discuss
with you.

As she turns to leave the room, Beatrix looks back to
see that Princess Iris' face has turned grim.

There have been many abductions in the capital lately,
solely targeting children...
That's awful. Does anyone know their motives?

The abducted children are of mixed status and race,
and none have been ransomed.
Their objective is probably...
Human trafficking.
(Makes me sick...)

We don't want to cause panic in the capital, so we're
conducting our investigations discreetly. Iif you
notice anything at all, Lady Beatrix...
Is that a request?

No, we only ask that you inform us if you notice
anything. That is all.
Understood. I'll bear that in mind.

Iris doesn't ask directly for Beatrix's assistance,
as her involvement may alert the culprits and
cause them to flee. The investigation needs to
remain discreet.

(I...seem to stand out, so that's why I usually cover
my face with a hood...)

This "Goddess of War" title is sometimes
such a burden...
What do you mean...?
Sorry. I was just mumbling to myself.

Beatrix is suddenly reminded of a certain young man,
one with incredible potential who seems to be hiding
his true strength. The one keeping a low profile...
Princess Iris, about Ci
Never mind. I'll head out now.

Princess Iris tilts her head as Beatrix leaves
her office.

(She's a busy princess. I can't bother her with the
whereabouts of a certain Academy student...)

(Cid...I wonder how he's doing. I wish I could've
crossed blades with him....)

The main street is overflowing with activity. Beatrix
had always thought of Midgar Kingdom as a busy
place, but with the Bushin Festival underway, it is
even busier than usual.

(Midgar truly is as lively as I remember... Especially
during the Bushin Festival.)

(It's good for a country to grow, but as it prospers,
so do criminals.)

(It's vital to have someone powerful to keep order.
That could be the Goddess of War, the Knight Order,
or Princess Iris. I wonder if he'll join the ranks
one day...)

Cid's face appears in her mind. What kind of thoughts
hide behind those eyes? His weak demeanor gives her
a sense that he doesn't know how to fight.

But there is definitely something dormant in him
She can not shake that gut feeling.
(Without a doubt he has tremendous abilities...)
(I wonder how he would use them...)
Hmm? That's...?

Maybe it is because she keeps thinking about him all
the time... Beatrix spots Cid in a large crowd.

He is holding something from Tuna King, which has
recently become popular. Although she is watching
him from a distance, as usual, his aura is weak.

(Whatever he's eating looks to be delicious.
He also looks so...vulnerable.)
(He's completely unaware of his surroundings.)
(Either he simply doesn't know how to fight, or...)

She finds it difficult to resist the urge to unveil
the latent power she feels he is hiding.
Hey, Cid.
Agh! *cough, cough*...!
Huh? B-B-Beatrix...?!
...I'm sorry for startling you.

(I didn't expect him to be so surprised...
Maybe I should've approached him directly...)
Um...is there anything...I can help you with?

I saw you by chance and thought I should say hello.
Also, I have been wanting to practice my swordplay

...Hmm, is that right? I don't know who you
practice with, but best of luck.
That was an invitation.
You must be joking. I'm nowhere near your level
You'll never know unless you try.

I'm afraid my arm gets strained when I hold something
heavier than a pen...
You seem to have no problems with that sandwich.
...Ow. Ouch! My stomach doesn't feel good...

If you drank too much cola, I can give you some
stomach medicine.

Um...oh, that's right. The curfew for the dormitory
is in ten minutes. I have to head back now...

Oh...it is? Rules are rules I suppose... I'll see you
tomorrow then.

Tomorrow and the day after tomorrow...I'm actually
the only student with an early curfew. Anyways!
I'll be going...
Anna?! Annaaa?!
Hm?
